definitions: Form (something) by putting parts together or combining substances; create.
Alter something so that it forms (something else)
Compose or draw up (something written or abstract)
Prepare (a dish, drink, or meal)
Arrange bedclothes tidily on (a bed) ready for use.
Arrange and light materials for (a fire).
Complete or close (a circuit).
Cause (something) to exist or come about; bring about.
Cause to become or seem.
Carry out, perform, or produce (a specified action or sound)
(in soccer) enable a teammate to score (a goal) by one's play.
Communicate or express (an idea, request, or requirement)
Enter into a contract of (marriage)
Appoint or designate (someone) to a position.
Represent or cause to appear in a specified way.
Cause to be successful.
Compel (someone) to do something.
Constitute; amount to.
Be suitable for or likely to develop into.
Consider to be; estimate as.
Agree or decide on (a specified arrangement)
Gain or earn (money or profit)
Score (a specified number of runs)
Manage to arrive at (a place) within a specified time or catch (a train or other form of transport)
Become successful.
Succeed in reaching safety or in surviving.
Achieve a place in.
Achieve the rank of.
Prepare to go in a particular direction.
Act as if one is about to perform an action.
Induce (someone) to have sexual intercourse with one.
(in bridge, whist, etc.) win (a trick).
Win a trick with (a card).
Win the number of tricks that fulfils (a contract).
Shuffle (cards) for dealing.
(of the tide) begin to flow or ebb.
